title: Installation issue: rocm-device-libs

<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

My `compilers.yaml` contains the following for using a Cray (GCC) compiler wrapper (which is the compiler I used for building `rocm-device-libs`:

```
- compiler:
    spec: gcc@8.3.0
    paths:
      cc: cc
      cxx: CC
      f77: ftn
      fc: ftn
    flags: {}
    operating_system: cnl7
    target: any
    modules:
    - PrgEnv-gnu
    - gcc/8.3.0
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
```

### Additional information

<!-- Please upload the following files. They should be present in the stage directory of the failing build. Also upload any config.log or similar file if one exists. -->
* [spack-build-env.txt](https://gist.github.com/msimberg/dddb18fbe184abcbc83dc5c782ce0f63)
* [spack-build-out.txt](https://gist.github.com/msimberg/849b1abbb066f8fe958b6565a708c38c)

<!-- Some packages have maintainers who have volunteered to debug build failures. Run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mention them here if they exist. -->

The actual problem seems to be in `llvm-amdgpu`. It does this when compiling with GCC:

```
        if self.compiler.name == "gcc":
            gcc_prefix = ancestor(self.compiler.cc, 2)
            args.append("-DGCC_INSTALL_PREFIX=" + gcc_prefix)
```

Since my `compilers.yaml` just contains `cc` for the C compiler (not the full path) `ancestor(self.compiler.cc, 2)` gives an empty path and `llvm-amdgpu` gets built with the `llvm-amdgpu` working directory as `GCC_INSTALL_PREFIX`. However, setting the full path to `cc` in `compilers.yaml` is not good enough either since it's a compiler wrapper. It's path is `/opt/cray/pe/craype/2.7.0/bin/cc` but

```
/opt/cray/pe/craype/2.7.0/bin/cc -print-search-dirs
install: /opt/gcc/8.3.0/snos/lib/gcc/x86_64-suse-linux/8.3.0/
...
```

so that would only give `GCC_INSTALL_PREFIX=/opt/cray/pe/craype/2.7.0` which is not correct.

@srekolam @arjun-raj-kuppala
